title: UK snow: Travel disruption still expected as snow begins to thaw - BBC News
summary: two yellow warnings for snow and ice remain in place .
rail disruption across the uk 's train operators .
flood alerts and warnings in the north east and south-west england .
friday 's lewisham trains disruption being investigated .

documents.title: wrap up warm
text: we are now wrapping up our live weather coverage for today .
sixteen flood warnings remain in place , on what has been another busy day for emergency services , airports and rail firms .
a yellow met office warning for ice applies for large areas of the uk and is not due to expire until 11:00 gmt on sunday .
the latest forecast is for fresh snow showers across much of scotland overnight , with heavy rain across the south of the uk .
the latest news updates will be on the bbc news website , while the latest forecasts can be found at the bbc weather centre .

documents.title: snooker star ronnie o'sullivan feeds homeless man in snow
text: snooker player ronnie o'sullivan bought food and drink for a homeless man lying in the snow in cardiff .
the five-time world champion had left the motorpoint arena after losing in the quarter-final of the welsh open when he came across the man on friday .
he went into a nearby store , bought sandwiches and drinks and handed them over .

documents.title: scottish councils offered emergency funds
text: an emergency funding scheme has been opened for local authorities in the wake of the severe weather .
the scottish government said it would consider applications for financial assistance after scottish borders council requested help .
the discretionary fund is designed to help councils which face extra costs as a result of large-scale emergencies .

documents.title: scottish communities 'heeding call to help '
text: communities across scotland have been answering the government 's call to work together to clear the snow .
scotland continues to recover from the so-called `` beast from the east '' with yellow weather warnings in place until monday .
transport has been slowly returning to service with the first cross-border trains to england resuming on saturday .
airports and trunk roads are also operating `` business as usual '' .

documents.title: power being restored despite high winds and snowfall
text: electricity north west has restored power to 22,600 homes , as of saturday afternoon , but it added that high winds and heavy snowfall on saturday meant that `` our teams of engineers are experiencing delays in restoring supplies '' .

documents.title: farmers 'just do n't know where to turn '
text: farmers 'just do n't know where to turn '

documents.title: watch : mcfly 's tom fletcher reveals snow scan
text: mcfly star tom fletcher and his wife giovanna find a novel way to announce they are expecting a third child .
in previous years the couple have reveal pregnancies through carved pumpkins and a video game-themed film .

documents.title: farmer forced to ditch 8,000 litres of milk
text: a farmer from somerset says he has had to throw away more than 8,000 litres of milk because lorries were unable to collect it during the snow storms .
mark wareham said tankers were unable to get `` anywhere near '' sunnyside farm in trudoxhill , near frome , for two days .
he said : `` it 's a massive impact - dairy farming is tight enough and hard enough without losing money , but what can you do ?
you 've just got to get on with it . ''

documents.title: elderly couple rescued by police
text: an elderly couple in the scottish borders whose remote home was surrounded by 12ft snow-drifts have been rescued , along with their two dogs .
the pair , aged 70 and 71 , had no heating and had run out of firewood when they were dug out of their west linton home by two police officers .

documents.title: network rail warns of flood risks , urges passengers not to travel
text: network rail 's latest statement makes clear that the extreme weather is continuing to cause major problems .
it says : `` our teams are putting in a huge amount of work to keep the railway running and passengers on the move .
`` however , there has been , and continues to be , significant snow in many areas and strong winds are causing it to drift , which is presenting a real challenge for workers on the ground . ''
the company says that , with temperatures expected to rise , it will be looking at its areas of flood risk , including checking bridges .
network rail reiterates its advice to passengers not to travel unless `` absolutely necessary '' .

documents.title: southeastern sorry over lewisham trains incident
text: southeastern has apologised after friday night 's incident at lewisham , when passengers frustrated with waiting for their trains to move got out and walked along the tracks .
it says : `` we understand the conditions were extremely difficult for them whilst we dealt with major disruption caused by ice affecting the power supply to our trains . ''
southeastern also makes the point that those passengers who evacuated the trains posed `` a significant risk to their safety '' .
it confirms that compensation will be provided to those `` directly affected '' and that the independent rail accident investigation branch will conduct a review of what happened .

documents.title: upside to match cancellation
text: although some football fans may be disappointed at today 's match cancellations , for homeless charities in birmingham there has been an upside .
aston villa football club has donated over 700 packed lunches - originally intended for football fans and staff - to local charities .

guy rippon , head of fundraising and community partnerships at the aston villa foundation charity , said : `` we had about 750 lunches , including sandwiches , crisps and pieces of fruit prepared and we did n't want them to go to waste just because the game was cancelled . ''

documents.title: funds offer for snow-hit scottish councils
text: the scottish government has opened an emergency funding scheme for local authorities dealing with disruptions caused by the weather .
the bellwin scheme was opened after the scottish borders council requested help .
it was last used in 2015 to repair flood damage in the borders and aberdeenshire .

finance secretary derek mackay said the scottish government was committed to helping local councils `` deal with any immediate and unforeseen costs resulting from the recent heavy snowfalls and ongoing cold weather . ''

documents.title: northern ireland weather warning extended
text: snow is continuing to affect the greater belfast area and parts of county down , while a yellow weather warning for ice for northern ireland has been extended until 11:00 gmt on sunday .
there is continued disruption on the roads and some flights at belfast city airport and belfast international airport have been cancelled .
three of saturday 's irish cup quarter-finals have been postponed .

documents.title: volunteers 'save lives ' in snow-hit somerset
text: at least 10 lives were saved by volunteers deployed in somerset to help people stranded overnight in snow , according to rescue co-ordinators .
among them were four people whose car was completely buried in a snow drift on the mendips and two hill-walkers who had to be rescued from exmoor .
duncan massey of avon & somerset search and rescue said the people would `` certainly have perished '' .
police warned that roads remained `` treacherous '' .

documents.title: police : 'stay on your train ! '

you are risking your life trespassing on live tracks . ''

it took a very , very long time and everything was backed-up all the way into london .
literally , no train passed us the whole time we were stopped .
nothing went in .
nothing went out . ''

documents.title: premier league games to go ahead despite snow
text: premier league games are expected to go ahead this weekend despite the freezing weather gripping the uk .
southampton have confirmed that they expect saturday 's game against stoke to go ahead after talks with hampshire police and southampton city council .
a premier league spokesman said they would continue to monitor the situation with seven games planned for saturday .
dozens of the weekend 's sporting fixtures are already postponed , with some being switched to sunday .
a total of 21 matches in the english football league are off , as is the entire scottish professional football league programme , although the four scottish cup quarter-finals could still go ahead .

documents.title: temperatures expected to rise over the weekend
text: the met office has active yellow warnings , as alerts for snow and icy roads remain in place across much of the uk .
one , warning of ice , applies to much of south-east england , the midlands , wales and northern ireland and is due to expire at 11:00 gmt .
the second warning - which is expected to be in place all day - is of further snow for much of scotland .
however , meteorologists say temperatures in many areas are set to rise above zero later .
author: Hanna Yusuf

documents.title: 'north-south split ' next week
text: there could be a north-south split in the weather outlook next week , according to paul gunderson , chief meteorologist at the met office .
he said : `` there will continue to be a risk of rain , sleet and snow at times .
`` the less cold air means there will be a gradual thaw , but this will freeze again overnight so ice is likely to be an additional overnight hazard together with low cloud and fog .
`` colder conditions will continue in the north , with snow showers , although less heavy and less frequent than of late . ''

documents.title: yellow warnings remain in place
text: the met office has two active yellow warnings in place for saturday .
one , warning of ice , applies to much of south-east england , the midlands , wales and northern ireland .
the warning - which is due to expire at 11:00 gmt - is for icy patches on untreated roads .
the second warning - until 23:55 gmt - is of further snow for much of scotland .
`` further delays to travel and public transport could occur , whilst some rural communities could become or remain cut off .
further impacts to power supplies/mobile phone coverage are also possible , '' the warning adds .

documents.title: flood warnings remain in place
text: the environment agency currently has 15 flood warnings in place - meaning immediate action is required .
of those , 11 are in devon , cornwall and elsewhere on the south coast , while four are in the north east .
there are 36 less serious flood alerts active .

documents.title: army helps get patients to hospital
text: work has continued throughout the night to ferry staff and patients in and out of torbay hospital , in devon , using 4x4 vehicles , bbc correspondent simon clemison has said .
main roads near the hospital are said to be clear , but issues remain with side roads .
volunteers have been helping transport people and the armed forces have also been assisting , our correspondent added .
the uk is `` counting the cost of extraordinary blizzards that have brought parts of the country to a standstill '' , according to the guardian .

it says : `` local authorities and the government , emergency services , transport companies , retailers , motorists and householders will face hefty bills to restore normality after the dramatic snowfall and gales . ''

documents.title: storm prompts 'mutiny on trains '
text: the daily telegraph says commuters in south-east london `` took matters into their own hands '' after their train was halted .
it says they pressed an emergency door release and got out onto the tracks when their train was held outside the station .
`` as a result , all lines through lewisham station were blocked , '' it said .
`` southeastern railway said the situation was getting worse 'because several people are jumping off trains onto the tracks ' , warning that it would only cause further delays .
`` power was switched off on trains because of the incident and the police and fire service were brought in to help get people off trains . ''

documents.title: newspapers feature weather images
text: saturday 's papers include some of the images from the aftermath of storm emma and the so-called beast from the east weather front hitting the uk .
the daily telegraph has a dramatic photograph of snow drifts on solsbury hill , just outside bath , on its front page .
meanwhile , the times has a photograph of a beach on dorset 's jurassic coast covered in snow on its front page .
to see all of saturday 's national front pages , click here .

southeastern said passengers could have been killed on the live tracks .

documents.title: newcastle to edinburgh line to remain suspended
text: virgin trains east coast have said the newcastle-to-edinburgh route will be suspended for the rest of the day and on saturday .
crosscountry trains are also investigating whether fresh snowfall will stop their services between the two cities on saturday .
# vtecupdate due to the ongoing extreme weather conditions , there will be no service between # newcastle and # edinburgh for the remainder of today and saturday 3rd march .
please continue to check here for further updates :
where exactly are the extreme weather conditions today ( march 3 ) , please , @ twitterid are actually the roads blocked between newcastle and edinburgh ?
if not , why are you not providing buses ?
i can find no information about blocked roads between newcastle and edinburgh .
sorry , we do n't want to rink buses breaking down in these conditions factoring in getting to and from stations .
^pa
so you 're saying if the train line does n't clear by tomorrow or monday , you will not provide any bus service ?
we 'll be able to confirm this closer to the time .
^pa
i see there are now ( today ) crosscountry trains from newcastle to edinburgh .
is the last one to be departing newcastle 18:37 or will later trains be added ?
due to travel tomorrow from edinburgh to london .
should i be trying to make alternative plans at this stage ?
your ticket is valid for tomorrow if you 're able to travel then ?
^pa
able to travel but still seeing that trains not running north of there any hope of that changing for tomorrow ?
yes , updates can be found here : ^pa
nothing helpful so far .
planning to try to get to newcastle myself today for train tomorrow .
will my ticket still be valid from there ?
yes , it will be .
sorry about this .
^pa
not your fault but an update tonight would be too late for me to make alternative arrangements so needed to confirm now .
will head to newcastle for train tomorrow .
thank you .
are there any other operators running b/w edinburgh and london tomorrow ?
none that will be running .
^sh
and when shall i check back for tomorrow 's services ?
we 're taking things day by day .
we wo n't know about sunday services until tomorrow night ( 3rd march ) at the earliest .
^km
i meant saturday the 3rd .
when would the earliest update for saturday 's services roll out ?
please see here : ^km
so depart from leeds at 06:05 and will stop at retford but what time is it due at retford please ?
hey , i have two advance singles : kings cross to edinburgh tomorrow ( 07:41 ) , and back on monday .
as trains are n't running there tomorrow , can i claim a refund for both tickets ?
you can , yes .
you 'll need to do this through the point of purchase .
^bg
thanks !
would that be through my account/my bookings ?
i used a 30 % off code from virgin red , will that code be reinstated for me to use again ?
yes , that is correct .
^sh
i chose `` service was cancelled/disrupted '' as the refund reason , it asks me to put in the journey details but wo n't let me put in the future dates .
should i choose a different reason/do something else ?
do i need to do this before 7:41 tomorrow or can i deal with it after ?
it can be dine after .
^sh
thank you !
that means i do n't have to rush and stress about it tonight , that 's great
snow update : we have heard from crews on the ground that more snow has formed between newcastle and edinburgh , which may affect our ability to run services between these two locations tomorrow .
we will update with a confirmation overnight when we know more .
i have seats booked for the 9.45am train from newcastle to edinburgh on sunday .
i 'm hoping the service will run by then but do you have any advice if it does n't ?
hi rachel .
at present we ca n't really advise whether we 'll be able to run this service or not .
if we do not run , you can get a full refund for your ticket if you do n't travel .
please check back with us tomorrow evening for updates .
^bw
okay will do , thank you !
thanks rachel !
^bw
no snow has fell ?
you said you were running an hourly service
it has fallen .
remember , between newcastle and edinburgh is 120 miles of railway .
^pf
right ?
so what about between newcastle and berwick ?
no service charlotte .
^pf
if you are running services to edinburgh from the north of england will you be accepting all other toc tickets ie vtec ?
@ twitterid
please see our latest travel update for tomorrow : ^bw
hi ive booked on a train from gloucester to birmingham .
are you anticipating running anyour services today
we do n't expect to serve gloucester today , no .
^rm
do they think it will be back to normal by tuesday ?
yes we think so !
^bw
what about people in doncaster why do you keep cancelling trains we ca n't get anywhere
there are a number of services running doncaster - york , doncaster - leeds and doncaster - sheffield who will accept our tickets and allow passengers to connect to our services .
^da
are you going to accept tickets from other providers from newcastle to edinburgh if it ends up working out ?
please see our twitter feed for latest update .
^pf
you literally just told me this service would run tomorrow
we literally tweeted out the second we got the info ewan .
that 's what we do .
^pf
fair reply .
sorry for being a pain in the arse
